title: Hamas rejects UN Gaza resolution, says international force would become party to conflict
byline: Hamas rejected the United Nations Security Council passing a U.S.-drafted resolution endorsing U.S. President Donald Trump’s Gaza plan, saying it fails to meet Palestinians’ rights and demands and seeks to impose an international trusteeship on the enclave that Palestinians and resistance factions oppose.

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The low pressure area over the island continues to persist and cloudy skies can be expected over most parts of the island, today (18), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: BBC ‘determined to fight’ Trump defamation claim
byline: The BBC is determined to fight any legal action filed by U.S. President Donald Trump and sees no basis for a defamation case over its editing of one of his speeches, its chair said on Monday.

title: Motorcycle used in Meetiyagoda shooting incident recovered
byline: The motorcycle suspected to have been used in the shooting incident near a restaurant at the Kiralagahawela junction in Meetiyagoda, last night (17), has been recovered by the Baddegama Police.

title: UN Security Council adopts US resolution on Trump’s Gaza plan
byline: The UN Security Council on Monday voted to adopt a U.S.-drafted resolution endorsing President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza and authorizing an international stabilization force for the Palestinian enclave.

title: Gambling Regulatory Authority Act to be implemented from Dec. 1
byline: The government has decided to implement the Gambling Regulatory Authority Act from December 01, 2025.

title: Police recover suspected narcotics parcel washed ashore in Bentota
byline: A parcel containing an estimated 20 to 25 kilograms of suspected narcotics substance has washed ashore and was recovered by police on Bentota Beach this morning, police said.

title: Married couple swept away by flash floods in Boralanda; one body recovered
byline: A married couple has reportedly been swept away by a flash floods in the Kandepuhulpola area of Boralanda in Welimada.

title: Foreign Ministry responds to Harsha’s comments, clarifies plans to overhaul outdated govt websites
byline: Responding to concerns raised by SJB MP Dr. Harsha de Silva in Parliament yesterday regarding the government’s outdated and non-functional official websites, Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs clarified that the issues stem from obsolete technological foundations used across government and diplomatic mission websites.

title: GMOA to continue trade union action
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) stated that the ongoing trade union action will continue today (18), citing the absence of a satisfactory solution to the concerns raised by the union.

title: Train services on main line delayed
byline: A signal failure at Orugodawatte has resulted in delays to train services on the main line, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Train derails at Ohiya, up-country services disrupted
byline: A train operating from Kandy to Badulla has derailed near the Ohiya Railway Station at around 4:00 a.m. this morning (18), according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: SC adjourns verdict on petitions challenging ASP promotions in 2019
byline: The Supreme Court has adjourned the announcement of its verdict on the Fundamental Rights petitions filed by 148 Chief Inspectors of Police (CIs), who claim they suffered severe injustice due to irregularities in the marking process of the interviews held for promotion to the rank of Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) in 2019.

title: Woman sentenced to life in prison for heroin possession
byline: The Colombo High Court has sentenced a woman to life imprisonment after she was found guilty of possessing and trafficking 42.23 grams of heroin.

title: 200kg of suspected narcotics found floating at sea off Beruwala
byline: A total of two parcels containing around 100 kilograms each of suspected narcotics were recovered during a joint operation conducted by the Western Province  North Police Crime Division and the Sri Lanka Navy this morning (18).

title: Investigations underway into politicians linked to underworld - Public Security Minister
byline: Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Ananda Wijepala stated that information regarding politicians allegedly linked to the underworld has emerged during the interrogations of recently arrested organized criminals and their associates including ‘Ishara Sewwandi’.

title: Supreme Court dismisses FR petition against ex-CBSL Governor Cabraal
byline: The Supreme Court has dismissed, without taking up for hearing, a fundamental rights petition filed by Venerable Thiniyawala Palitha Thero against a group including former Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Ajith Nivard Cabraal.

title: Veteran radio icon Chithra Kalubowila passes away
byline: Veteran radio presenter and journalist Chithra Kumari Kalubowila has passed away at the age of 68, family sources confirmed.

title: Bill seeking to abolish MPs’ pensions gets Cabinet nod
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the submission of the Parliamentary Pensions Law (Repeal) Draft Bill for consideration and approval in Parliament.

title: Couple swept away by flash floods in Boralanda: Husband’s body also recovered
byline: The body of the man who went missing after being swept away by flash floods along with his wife in the Kandepuhulpola area of Boralanda, Welimada, yesterday (18), has also been recovered.

title: Cabinet approval to provide Rs. 7,000 allowance police officers – Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated that the Cabinet of Ministers has approved the provision of an allowance of Rs. 7,000 for police officers.

title: Saudi crown prince to visit US with defence, AI, nuclear on agenda
byline: A visit by Saudi Arabia’s de facto ruler to the White House for talks on Tuesday with U.S. President Donald Trump aims to deepen decades-old cooperation on oil and security while broadening ties in commerce, technology and potentially even nuclear energy.

title: Indian HC extends birthday wishes to ex-President Mahinda
byline: High Commissioner of India, Santosh Jha, has extended his best wishes to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on the occasion of his 80th birthday which falls today (18).

title: Seethawaka PS Chairman Election: Sarvajana Balaya councilor’s party membership suspended
byline: The Sarvajana Balaya party has decided to suspend the party membership of Chandana Premanath Mudunkotuwa for acting against the party’s decision during the vote held to elect the Chairman of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: Sri Lanka signs bilateral debt restructuring agreement with Denmark
byline: Sri Lanka has signed a bilateral agreement with the Government of Denmark to restructure USD 39 million of outstanding debt, marking a key milestone in the country’s External Debt Restructuring Process.

title: France’s Louvre Museum closes gallery due to structural weakness
byline: France’s Louvre Museum on Monday closed a gallery hosting Greek vases and office spaces as its structures designed in the 1930s are in a dire state, the world’s most visited museum said, less than a month after a daring heist exposed its vulnerabilities.

title: India’s US exports jump despite 50% tariffs as trade tensions ease
byline: India’s goods exports to the US rose for the first time in five months in October, jumping 14.5% from September, even as Donald Trump’s steep tariffs remain in place.

title: NPP claims power in Seethawaka PS six months after the conduct of LG election
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) today established power in the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha, over six months after the conduct of the Local Government (LG) election.

title: India introduces digital wallet service ‘UPI One World’ for Sri Lankan visitors
byline: A pilot initiative to introduce UPI One World digital service for Sri Lankan Buddhist pilgrims visiting India has been launched.

title: ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 113 mln found inside luggage left behind at BIA
byline: A large consignment of “Kush” cannabis, with an estimated street value of Rs. 113,670,000, has been discovered yesterday (18) at the bonded warehouse containing luggage and belongings left behind by passengers and confiscated by customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Plane carrying Congo minister, 20 others bursts into flames; skids off runway
byline: A chartered Embraer ERJ‑145LR carrying Democratic Republic of Congo mines minister Louis Watum Kabamba and around 20 others onboard skidded off the runway and caught fire at Kolwezi Airport on Monday.

title: “Don’t add fuel to the fire and make it worse”: Cabinet Spokesman on Trinco incident
byline: If police committed any wrongdoing while removing a Buddha statue that had been placed at a temple premises in Trincomalee, an investigation will be conducted and necessary action will be taken, Cabinet Media Spokesperson, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: No firm is immune if AI bubble bursts, Google CEO tells BBC
byline: Alphabet Chief Executive Sundar Pichai said no company would be unscathed if the artificial intelligence boom collapses, as soaring valuations and heavy investment in the sector fuel concerns of a bubble.

title: Gazette to be issued imposing controlled prices for 350 types of medicines
byline: Controlled prices have been set for a wide range of medicines and relevant gazette notification will be issued shortly, Cabinet Spokesperson Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has announced.

title: Over 20 tons of drugs seized so far this year - Public Security Minister
byline: Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Ananda Wijepala stated that over 20 tons of narcotics have been seized since January 01 up to this date.

title: Teacher arrested in connection with sexual abuse of Moratuwa school student remanded
byline: A teacher, who was taken into custody in connection with the sexual abuse of a 14-year-old student, has been remanded.

title: Showers to reduce from tomorrow: Met. Dept.
byline: The low pressure area located around Sri Lanka is gradually moving away from the island and therefore the showery weather condition over the country is likely to reduce from tomorrow (19), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Eminem sues Australian beach brand ‘Swim Shady’
byline: US rapper Eminem has taken legal action against an Australian beachwear company called Swim Shady, saying its name is too similar to his trademarked rap pseudonym Slim Shady.

title: Landslide early warnings issued for several districts
byline: Early landslide warning have been issued for several districts of the island owing to the prevailing heavy rain experienced in parts of the island.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu calls for Hamas’ expulsion from the region, after UN vote
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday called for Hamas to be expelled from the region, a day after the U.N. Security Council endorsed President Donald Trump’s plan to end the war that offers the Palestinian militant group amnesty.

title: X.com faces outage again: Users unable to access accounts
byline: Elon Musk’s X was down for thousands of users in the U.S. on Tuesday, according to Downdetector.com.

title: Bitcoin slides below $90,000 as traders grow cautious
byline: Bitcoin fell below $90,000 for the first time in seven months on Tuesday in the latest sign that investor appetite for risk is drying up across financial markets.

title: Writ filed seeking order to prevent demolition of portion of Trincomalee Sambuddha Bodhiraja temple
byline: A writ petition has been filed in the Court of Appeal requesting the issuance of an order to prevent the demolition of a portion of the Trincomalee Sri Sambuddha Jayanthi Bodhiraja Viharaya.

title: Gazette to be issued imposing price control on 350 types of medicines
byline: Controlled prices have been set for a wide range of medicines and relevant gazette notification will be issued shortly, Cabinet Spokesperson Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has announced.

title: President to call for report on recent Trincomalee incident from Public Security Ministry
byline: A report will be called from the Secretary to the Ministry of Public Security on the recent Trincomalee incident, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated.

title: Expenditure heads of Defence and Public Security ministries passed by majority vote
byline: The expenditure heads of the Ministry of Defence and the Ministry of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs were passed by a majority vote in Parliament this evening.

title: Abidur Chowdhury, celebrated designer behind iPhone Air, leaves Apple
byline: Abidur Chowdhury, the celebrated designer of iPhone Air fame, has left Apple, unsettling the consumer electronics giant’s design team, news agency Bloomberg reported on November 18.

title: Couple shot dead in Unakuruwa, Tangalle
byline: A couple has been killed in a shooting incident reported in Unakuruwa Tangalle, police stated.

title: Govt. seeks structured programme to resolve issues faced by potato farmers
byline: A discussion aimed at formulating a systematic programme to address the challenges of local potato farmers was held this morning (18) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Donald Trump hosts Saudi crown prince Salman for pomp-filled, deal-making visit
byline: President Donald Trump hosted Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to the White House on Tuesday, with the Saudi de facto ruler seeking to further rehabilitate his global image after the 2018 killing of U.S.-based journalist Jamal Khashoggi and deepen ties with Washington.

title: US keen to expand defence cooperation with Sri Lanka - US Envoy Julie Chung
byline: The State Partnership Program (SPP) Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Montana National Guard and the Ministry of Defence—signed on November 14 reinforces the shared commitment to transparency and trust, U.S. Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung has stated.

title: Namal accuses Govt. of ignoring professionals when preparing 2026 Budget
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) held a meeting today (18) with Namal Rajapaksa, the National Organizer of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP).
